wrangling_procedure: Download .maf file from TCGA DCC, processed into gene by sample matrix at UCSC, stored in the UCSC Xena repository
dataProducer: Baylor College of Medicine Human Genome Sequencing Center
label: STAD gene-level mutation (bcm automated)
gdata_tags: Baylor College of Medicine Human Genome Sequencing Center
description:
TCGA stomach adenocarcinoma (STAD) somatic mutation data. Sequencing data are generated on a IlluminaGA system. The calls are generated at Baylor College of Medicine Human Genome Sequencing Center using the Baylor pipeline method.

Red (=1) indicates that a non-silent somatic mutation (nonsense, missense, frame-shif indels, splice site mutations, stop codon readthroughs, change of start codon, inframe indels) was identified in the protein coding region of a gene, or any mutation identified in a non-coding gene. White (=0) indicates that none of the above mutation calls were made in this gene for the specific sample.
longTitle: TCGA stomach adenocarcinoma (STAD) gene-level nonsilent somatic mutation (bcm automated)
name: TCGA_STAD_mutation_bcm_gene
